content:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/78838 on the CI had a apt-get segfault, and
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/78846 had ld segfault.
(not sure if related. but that's the third rollup in a row with a weird failure)

Similar segfault in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75199#issuecomment-723448462
Sounds like CI provider issue.
(this may be completely off, but some dependencies missing in the vm/container or limit on the open files?)
The fourth rollup failed too, this time on the apple lldb thing again. I'm giving up for today :/

Maybe the CI image got updates for some system library (glibc?) that turned out to be incorrect? Missing dependencies or file limits should never cause segfaults like this, especially not in different programs.
